meanings.definition: A person or machine that gathers or collects things into a group or cluster.
meanings.sent1: The buncher quickly gathered all the fallen leaves into a neat pile.
meanings.sent2: The farm had a buncher that collected the ripe apples from the trees.
meanings.sent3: The buncher robot kept bumping into walls as it tried to gather the scattered toys.
meanings.sent4: She was a buncher of stories, always collecting interesting tales from her travels.
meanings.sent5: The buncher's job was to gather all the colorful balloons after the party.

meanings.definition: A group or cluster of things that are gathered or collected together.
meanings.sent1: The buncher of keys jingled loudly in his pocket.
meanings.sent2: The flowers formed a beautiful buncher in the vase on the table.
meanings.sent3: The buncher of socks in the drawer seemed to multiply overnight.
meanings.sent4: The stars in the sky looked like a buncher of twinkling diamonds.
meanings.sent5: The children's laughter created a buncher of joy in the playground.
